info.title: Account Arrangements
info.description: The Arrangement Architecture is a Temenos Transact Framework to create and manage  various products such as loans, deposits, accounts, etc. It provides a modular business component-based architecture, whereby users can create their products by using the components provided by Temenos and these components can be reused across multiple different products.This API can be used to create and manage various types of accounts such as current, savings, corporate, islamic, non-resident and minor accounts created using the Arrangement Architecture.

post.description: Allows to create and manage various types of accounts such as current, savings, corporate, islamic, non-resident and minor accounts created using the Arrangement Architecture.  Pool accounts can also be created for Notional pooling purpose

get.summary: Retrieves the statement details for the given account
get.description: Retrieves the statement details of the transactions for the given account such as booking date, value date, transaction reference, transaction code, debit or credit amount, closing balance based on the given dates(from date and to date).If dates are not given, retrieves the last 1M transactions.If from date alone is given, retrieves the transactions from given date to today.If end date alone is given, retrieves the last 1M transactions prior to the given end date.If period is given, retrieves the transactions for the period.If account id and transaction id are given, retrieves that particular transaction details

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Indicates the business date from when the balance reservation event is active.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Indicates the business date until when the balance reservation event is active.

parameters.name: transactionReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction in the core system

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

contractId.description: Indicates the unique identifier of the transaction or contract which initiated the activity

systemId.description: System ID of the originating transaction

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

progPercentage.description: Used to specify the progressive percentage with which the system calculated payment amount has to progress on every payment

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

finaliseBill.description: Defines the number of days prior to the actual payment, when a bill needs to be finalised. This allows the user or customer to make amendments to an issued bill through the Payment Holiday activity with as many number of times, between the issue date and finalisation date. When zero days is defined, then user or customer will be allowed to make amendments to an issued bill through Payment Holiday activity until the payment date

issueBill.description: Flag to indicate whether we need to issue bill and make it due separately or together. If the field is set to NO, then both would be combined and performed as a single activity

deferPeriod.description: Period that defines how long the scheduled payment should be deferred from original cycled date. If defined, then on the cycled date, system will schedule deferring makedue or deferring capitalise activities moving the bills to defer status. On actual cycled date plus Defer Period, system will schedule make due or capitalise activities where bills will be moved out from defer status to their respective status

payments.description: Indicates the initiation of payment for an account

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

accountTypes.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

accountNames.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

dormancyStatus.description: Specifies the operative status of the acount like inactive, dormant,unclaimed etc.,

period.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

charge.description: The charges or fees for this transaction

chargeFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency in which the periodic charges are posted. Allowed values are for example, 20091223DAILY. It is mandatory when the charge frequency is set as periodic.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

payout.description: Details of the concentration account to which the surplus funds available in the sweeping account is paid out to.

postingRestriction.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

restrictionReason.description: Sets restrictions on the actions that can be performed on an account. Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName BLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionText.description: Free text information to capture the reason for restriction applied on an account

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

expiryDate.description: This indicates the  date  on which the offer or privilege terminates for the event.

unrestrictionReason.description: Captures the code that removes the restriction set on an account.  Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName UNBLOCK.REASON.CODES.

unrestrictionText.description: Reason for unblocking the restriction set on an account

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRoles.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

agentCustomerIds.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentRoles.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productVariation.description: It defines the type of a customer based on criteria defined by Bank, Eg: Gold Customer, Mobile Banking Customer

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

fields.description: Input is the valid field name for the metrics evaluation of alerts

offsetPropertyClass.description: Indicates the property class which needs to be used for settlement offset

offsetProperty.description: Indicates the property which needs to be used for settlement offset

payOutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

expiryDays.description: Contains the period within which the locked rate needs to be availed.

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

accountTitle2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

addressLine1.description: Indicates first line of the address of the BIC

addressLine2.description: Indicates second line of the address of the BIC

street.description: Contains the street name of the customer or the property

townCountry.description: The town and country associated with the address

postCode.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer or the property

country.description: Identifies the country of the customer or a property or organization

accountNumber.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

todayDate.description: Date of the current business day for all online activities in the selected Company. This field is updated automatically with the date from 'nextWorkingDay' during the Close of Business processing.

jointHolderId.description: The identifier of the joint holder

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

openingBalance.description: Balance brought forward from the previous date/period.

totalDebits.description: Contains the total number of debits

totalCredits.description: Contains the total number of credits

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

contractId.description: Indicates the unique identifier of the transaction or contract which initiated the activity

systemId.description: System ID of the originating transaction

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

minimumPaymentBillType.description: Specify the bill type for which minimum payment amount must be made due or capitalised

minimumPaymentAmount.description: minimum amount that needs to be made due or capitalised for the associated bill type

bookingDate.description: Indicates the date on which this business activity is booked in the underlying system. The effective date and booking date could be different if systems allow forward/back dated business transactions. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format. If booking date is not passed, effective date would be assumed as booking date.

transactionReference.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction in the core system

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

masterArrangementId.description: The unique identifier to specify an arrangement reference which is act as a Master for the arrangement being created.

roleName.description: Name of the role or sub contract that is displayed, for eg: Payments Inputter, Administrator, Clerk and etc.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

channel.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

branch.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

lineOfBusiness.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

printAttributeNames.description: It denotes the values that can be either used to make decisions during statement processing or to pass on the value to down-stream systems.

printAttributeValues.description: It denotes the associated value against the attribute name to make decisions during statement processing or to pass on the value to down-stream systems

percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

baseDay.description: Indicates the base day which will be used to cycle the Payment date

businessDayCentres.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

referalCodes.description: Indicates the conditions under which account details or details of entries over the account are to be included in an end of day report for referral to the account officer responsible. Referral conditions can be defined depending on transaction such as transaction code, amount and sign, or the balance of the Account.

postingRestrictions.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

aprTypes.description: Indicates the type of Annual Percentage Rate calculation selected for Reporting. Available options such as Cashflow,Interest

otherOfficers.description: Specifies the additional officers who can assist with a product/arrangement

mnemonic.description: Shortcut code for referring an Entity/Company/Branch.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

accountingCompany.description: Indicates the accounting company of the account record

originationReference.description: Identifier of the account in source system, eg, a origination system.

category.description: Indicates the account or contract product name. For example for an account this maybe current, savings etc.

baseDateType.description: Defines if anniversaryDate or start date is based on account creation or once disbursement is done. Allowed values are ARRANGEMENT and DISBURSEMENT. ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

dateConvention.description: Indicates how the schedule date has to be adjusted when the schedule falls on a holiday. Allowed values are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

inactiveMonths.description: Indicates the number of months without customer activity before an account is declared as inactive

baseDateKey.description: Indicates the option to specify the basis for deriving the future event dates.Allowed values are previous(last adjusted event date will be used for deriving) ,base(last unadjusted event date provided by user will be used for deriving and null(change product ,renewal event base date will be used for deriving)

primaryOfficer.description: Specify the primary officer responsible for the arrangement

adjustProperties.description: Indicates the interest or account or charge properties for which balances are to be captured or adjusted.

adjustmentDisplayname.description: Denotes the description for the adjustment

netAdjustmentAmount.description: The net adjustment for non-contingent balance types would be calculated and stored in this field by the system during Balance Adjustment, Write off activities of Balance maintenance.

adjustmentDifferenceAccount.description: Represents the account number to be used while adjusting balance amounts

businessDayCentre.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

expiryDays.description: Contains the period within which the locked rate needs to be availed.

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

Percentage.description: Percentage of holdings that can be pledged as collateral

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

Action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

payInSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payInRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payInRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payInRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

paymentTypes.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

reference.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payinSettlement1.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not. Valid input is Yes or No. Default value is Yes

ddMandateRef11.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount11.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary11.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPercentage11.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount11.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinRcType1.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRcCondition1.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

defaultBeneficiary.description: Indicates the beneficiary the payment should be made to in default.

updatePendingRetry.description: If this field is set to YES, then whenever user changes the Payin settlement accounts then the modified accounts should affect the pending funding requests raised for the current overdue Bills. If this field is set to NO or blank then the changes to the payin settlement accounts apply to the next due bills

accountSettlement.description: Specifies the account at which the interest or payment settlement is to be made.

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

offsetRequired.description: Indicates if the settlement offset is required

offsetPayInActivity.description: Indicates the offset payment rule activity that defines the list of due balances which need to be offset using the pay balance. For example, ACCOUNTS-OFFSET-REPAYRULE1, ACCOUNTS-OFFSET-REPAYRULE2, etc

offsetPayOutActivity.description: Indicates the offset payout rule activity which defines the list of pay balances which need to be debited to offset due balance created. For example, ACCOUNTS-OFFSET-PAYOUTRULE, ACCOUNTS-OFFSET-PAYOUTRULE2, etc

customers.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

adjustBalanceType.description: Indicates the balance type which is corresponding to the captured or adjusted property. It should be non-bill related balance type that are not currently linked to the arrangement. For example, balance types are CURACCOUNT, ACCPRINCIPALINT, AVLACCOUNT, etc.

originalBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the original balance amount for the each of the given balance type.

newBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the new balance amount for the corresponding balance type while capturing a new balance type or adjusting an existing balance type. This is a signed field. For write off activities, system will default this field to zero.

adjustBalanceAmount.description: Indicates the adjusted balance amount for the corresponding balance type. This is a signed field, sign used to indicate the debit or credit entry to be passed based on the balance type and the product line of the product.

writeOff.description: Indicates the removal of an asset from the balance sheet due to impairment, obsolescence, or other factors

writeOffAmount.description: Indicates that the corresponding balance needs to be written off partially. It should not be greater than the original balance amount.

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

synchronous.description: Indicates that this simulation capture is a synchronous request

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRoles.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

agentCustomerIds.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentRoles.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productVariation.description: It defines the type of a customer based on criteria defined by Bank, Eg: Gold Customer, Mobile Banking Customer

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

channel.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

services.description: It specifies the list of services related to the arrangement.

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

serviceAvailability.description: It will indicate whether the corresponding service is available for arrangement account

customerOption.description: It will indicate whether user has opted the service or not.

consolidatePayments.description: Specifies whether the settlement has to be combined for payments with same frequency, same beneficiary and same payment order product.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payInAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payInBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payInPoProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payInPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payInAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payInActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

beneficialOwner.description: Indicates the customer who is the legal owner of the arrangement and is the responsible customer of the contract with bank.

productDescription.description: Indicates the description of the Product

arrangementStartDate.description: Indicates the date on which the arrangement was created

originalContractDate.description: Indicates the original contract date of the arrangement which was migrated from the legacy system.

arrangementStatus.description: Status of the arrangement. E.g. AUTH, CLOSE, UNAUTH etc.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

branch.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

aaaId.description: The Identifier of the aa record created

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

agentRole.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

accountTitles2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

shortTitles.description: Contains the short title given to the name of an account or an arrangement

postingRestrictions.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

contractId.description: Indicates the unique identifier of the transaction or contract which initiated the activity

systemId.description: System ID of the originating transaction

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

masterArrangementId.description: The unique identifier to specify an arrangement reference which is act as a Master for the arrangement being created.

roleName.description: Name of the role or sub contract that is displayed, for eg: Payments Inputter, Administrator, Clerk and etc.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

channel.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

branch.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

lineOfBusiness.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant.

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

taxLiabilityPercentage.description: Tax liability percentage of the customer

limitAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates percentage of limit allocated to the customer out of overall limit

GLAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates GL allocation percentage of the customer

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

usagePercent.description: The percent defined will be applied on the reference rate before applying margin and other interest adjustments

type.description: The product condition has an activity type associated that drives an action.

period.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

method.description: A pricing plan can be applied to an account, the selection is automatic or manual

initialDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset. If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

reset.description: This indicates the reset period of the index stated. System would automatically reset the periodic rate at the frequency stated here

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

operand.description: This field along with fieldName and value, defines the conditions for the alert to be triggered.

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

rfrConvention.description: Define the market convention to be used as risk free rate calculation convention

rfrLookbackType.description: Specifies the type to be used for risk free rates calculation. Allowed options are NARROW, OBSERVATION SHIFT. Narrow Definition: Apply original interest periods day count to the look back rate used for this day (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Fridays weight, three days, to Wednesdays rate). Observation Shift: Apply the original day count of the look back rate (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Wednesdays own weight, one day, and do not use Fridays day count for it)

rfrCalculationMethod.description: Define the type of formula used to calculate the rate. There are two types.  1. Simple - Simple Average Calculation (Arithmetic Mean) 2. Compound -  Compound Average Calculation (geometric mean)

rfrLookbackDays.description: Specifies the backward looking period for the risk free rates calculation. Example  An arrangement is creating on 15-May-2020 with look back days as 2. Then during RFR compounding rate calculation, system would use the risk free rate published on 13-May-2020. So, it will look back to 2 days and get the rate

rfrSpreadTreatment.description: Define how the Spread inputted in the interest definition would be used as part of risk free rate calculation. Inclusive  The spread inputted in definition will be used in risk free rate formula itself to calculate the Compounding RFR rate. Exclusive  The spread inputted in the definition will be added on top of formula calculated Compounding RFR rate

rfrPeriodDayCount.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

rfrRoundingRule.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will use only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will use the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

accountTitles2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

shortTitles.description: Contains the short title given to the name of an account or an arrangement

alternateIds.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

businessDayCentres.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

referalCodes.description: Indicates the conditions under which account details or details of entries over the account are to be included in an end of day report for referral to the account officer responsible. Referral conditions can be defined depending on transaction such as transaction code, amount and sign, or the balance of the Account.

postingRestrictions.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are to be imposed on the Account

aprTypes.description: Indicates the type of Annual Percentage Rate calculation selected for Reporting. Available options such as Cashflow,Interest

mnemonic.description: Shortcut code for referring an Entity/Company/Branch.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

accountingCompany.description: Indicates the accounting company of the account record

originationReference.description: Identifier of the account in source system, eg, a origination system.

category.description: Indicates the account or contract product name. For example for an account this maybe current, savings etc.

baseDateType.description: Defines if anniversaryDate or start date is based on account creation or once disbursement is done. Allowed values are ARRANGEMENT and DISBURSEMENT. ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

dateConvention.description: Indicates how the schedule date has to be adjusted when the schedule falls on a holiday. Allowed values are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

inactiveMonths.description: Indicates the number of months without customer activity before an account is declared as inactive

baseDateKey.description: Indicates the option to specify the basis for deriving the future event dates.Allowed values are previous(last adjusted event date will be used for deriving) ,base(last unadjusted event date provided by user will be used for deriving and null(change product ,renewal event base date will be used for deriving)

unrestrictionText.description: Reason for unblocking the restriction set on an account

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

type.description: The product condition has an activity type associated that drives an action.

sendType.description: It denotes whether the sending of message MT941 (Balance Report) / MT942 (Interim Transaction Report) happens on an ad-hoc or timed daily basis.

payout.description: Details of the concentration account to which the surplus funds available in the sweeping account is paid out to.

defaultSettlementAccounts.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

updatePendingRetry.description: If this field is set to YES, then whenever user changes the Payin settlement accounts then the modified accounts should affect the pending funding requests raised for the current overdue Bills. If this field is set to NO or blank then the changes to the payin settlement accounts apply to the next due bills

alternateIds.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

contextName.description: Field name returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

contextValue.description: Field value returned by the payment engine (TPH) for information or further processing.

autoSettle.description: Indicates if the settlement is automatic at the Customer / Broker side

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

narratives.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

bookingDate.description: Indicates the date on which this business activity is booked in the underlying system. The effective date and booking date could be different if systems allow forward/back dated business transactions. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format. If booking date is not passed, effective date would be assumed as booking date.

transactionReference.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction in the core system

transactionCode.description: Identifies the system internal transaction code applicable to the transaction

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

debitAmount.description: Amount to be debited in a payment transaction

creditAmount.description: Amount to be credited in a payment transaction

sharedLimitAccounts.description: Denotes the accounts in which the credit card Limit is assigned to the customer across all the credit cards

sharedLimitAccount.description: Denotes the accounts in which the credit card Limit is assigned to the customer across all the credit cards

sharedLimitAccountType.description: Indicates the type of shared limit account

taxRates.description: Indicates tax charged to an account

taxRate.description: Indicates tax charged to an account

interestPropertyName.description: Contains the property name of loan interest such as penalty Interest and principal interest.

interestCompoundType.description: Indicates the interest compound type of an account

interestCompoundTypeValue.description: Indicates the interest compound type value of an account

interestPaidYtd.description: Interest paid from the start of current year till current date

accrualAmount.description: Indicates interest accumulated for an account for the defined time period

consolidateInterests.description: Contains the sum of the cash interest expense (including that attributable to Capitalized Leases), net of cash interest income, of the Borrower and the Restricted Subsidiaries, determined on a consolidated basis.

consolidateInterest.description: Contains the sum of the cash interest expense and net of cash interest income of the borrower and the restricted subsidiaries determined on a consolidated basis

sharedInterestAccounts.description: Contains the account details which shares the interest among the eligible or joint customers.

sharedInterestAccount.description: Contains the account details which shares the interest among the eligible or joint customers.

sharedInterestAccountType.description: Indicates the type of shared interest account

charges.description: The charges or fees for this transaction

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

paymentTypeName.description: Indicates Payment type set to an account

propertyName.description: Indicates the  property description to which benefit has been applied

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

chargeSchedulePaymentValue.description: Indicates the payment frequency associated with the charge

customerName.description: Indicates the name of the customer. Originator is the party who requests the payment cancellation.

jointRelationRoleId.description: Role of joint customer with the main customer

jointRoleDisplayName.description: Description of the joint customer role.

allowedcurrencies.description: Field denotes the currency set as allowed currency in Master account conditions.

openActualBalance.description: Contains the opening actual balance of an account

availableOverdraftLimit.description: Contains the overdraft limit still available to be utilized

openingDate.description: Date on which the credit facility application is opened

limitExpiryDate.description: This field specifies the validity of the Limit, i.e. how long is it to remain in force

availableFunds.description: Total funds available in the account after all the ongoing transactions have been completed

outstandingOverdraftLimit.description: Indicates the outstanding overdraft limit of an account

onlineClearedBalance.description: Indicates the available balance allowed to use

openClearedBalance.description: Indicates the opening balance after clearing

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

totalPendingDepositAmount.description: Contains the total of the deposit amounts which may be available for use in near future

customerName.description: Indicates the name of the customer. Originator is the party who requests the payment cancellation.

totalCredits.description: Contains the total number of credits

totalDebits.description: Contains the total number of debits

commitmentAmount.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

totalPendingWithdrawalAmount.description: Contains the total withdrawal amount on hold until payment execution date

lockedAmount.description: Shows reserved amount for the underlying account for a given balance reservation event.

IBAN.description: International Bank Account number, an identifier of the account. E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

profitRate.description: Indicates the profit rate for the contract.

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

writeOffProperty.description: Indicates the interest or account or charge property for which write off activity can be performed.

originalPropertyAmount.description: Indicates the original amount of a given property for a payment type.

outstandingPropertyAmount.description: Indicates the outstanding bill amount of a given property for a payment type.

newPropertyAmount.description: Indicates the oustanding amount of interest or account or charge property after bill adjustment. For write off activities, system will default zero amount in this field.

adjustPropertyAmount.description: Indicates the bill adjustment amount for the given property. This can be signed. Sign used to indicate the increment or decrement of the bill interest or account or charge property amount.

amortEndDate.description: Indicates the amortisation end date for an amortisation type of charge.

outstandingAmortAmount.description: Indicates the outstanding bill amount of a given property for a payment type.

newAmortizationAmount.description: Indicates the new charge amount which is specified during adjustment of the amortisation charge. The specified value will be the new amount outstanding and yet to be amortised.

adjustAmortAmount.description: Indicates the adjustment amount for the charge during adjustment. The new charge amount will be calculated from the unamortised amount and the adjustment amount. Either a value in this field or the new amort amount will be allowed during adjustment. The value should be given in arrangement currency.
